thread.title: Look at the entries in our garden photo contest: Where's yours?
thread.title_full: Look at the entries in our garden photo contest: Where's yours? | OregonLive.com

author: Janet Eastman | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Look at the entries in our garden photo contest: Where's yours?
text:
Our annual Homes & Gardens of the Northwest's Garden Photo Contest is more than just pretty pictures. It's a chance for all of us to see more of the visually captivating private and public gardens that have helped make the Northwest famous among foliage and flower fans.
You can see the entries submitted so far and the range of topics amateur photographs have captured, from hummingbirds to maple trees.
There's another reason to look: You will soon be able to vote for your favorite and help someone win one of four $100 prizes plus have their photo posted online and in print.
Where is your photo? It's time for you to submit your online entry to the annual Homes & Gardens of the Northwest's Garden Photo Contest.
There's no theme; it's shooter's choice. As long as the original photo is taken in a garden -- public or private -- in the Pacific Northwest in the last year, it's eligible to win.
There will be four winners: Three selected by staff members of The Oregonian and Homes & Gardens of the Northwest and one voted on by the public . The winning photos and some runners-up will appear in the last issue of the Homes & Gardens of the Northwest and displayed on OregonLive.com.
Ten images will be selected by us as finalists and are eligible for your online vote as the People's Choice and fourth place winner.
To enter, submit your original digital photo at oregonlive.com/hg-photo between Oct. 21 and Oct. 31, 2015. It's quick and easy, and you can see the other entries.
If you have a printed photograph, have it scanned and made into a digital image to submit online. Large grocery store chains and copy service stores will scan and digitize your image onto a flashdrive. With that, you can go online and enter the contest.
RULES to get you launched (see the complete rules)
Photos must be taken over the last year, between Oct. 31, 2014 and Oct. 31, 2015, in a garden in the Northwest. Amateur photographers only; no professional photos accepted. Maximum of three photos per person. No digital alteration of photos is allowed. Prints (not preferred as entries) may be any size between 3-by-5 and 11-by-14 inches. If you must mail a print, tape completed entry form or a 3-by-5 card with the same information, right side up, to the back of each print entered. (A copy of the form or a 3-by-5 card MUST BE ATTACHED to EACH photo; entries without one or the other will not be considered.) Printed entries must be postmarked by Oct. 31 and mailed to Homes & Gardens of the Northwest, The Oregonian/Oregonlive.com, 1500 SW First Avenue Suite 400, Portland, Oregon 97201. The judges' decision is final. Judges are staff members of The Oregonian and Homes & Gardens of the Northwest. Staff members of The Oregonian and their families are not eligible. All photos become property of Oregon Media Group and cannot be returned. Entry constitutes permission to print photos and gardener/photographer information in Homes & Gardens of the Northwest and to display on OregonLive.com without further compensation. Winners will be notified by Dec. 12; winning photos will be printed in the Saturday, Dec. 26, edition of the Homes & Gardens of the Northwest Entries will be judged on photographic merit. TIPS AND IDEAS
Usually, morning or late afternoon light is best. Avoid shooting between 10 a.m. and 2 p.m., when overhead light is flat. Look for repetition of shapes, reflections, lovely designs in nature. Get close to your subject. Look for clean backgrounds. Good luck!
-- Janet Eastman
